40.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
40.str2: From a compound of gonu and the alternate of pipto; to fall on the knee.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

40.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
40.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

40.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
40.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

41.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
41.str2: To feel compassion, have pity on, be moved.

41.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
41.str2: To stretch out (forth), cast forth (as of an anchor), lay hands on. From ek and teino; to extend.

41.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

41.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.

41.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
41.str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

41.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
41.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

41.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
41.str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

42.str2: Immediately, soon, at once. Adverb from euthus; directly, i.e. At once or soon.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Leprosy. From the same as lepis; scaliness, i.e. 'leprosy'.

42.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

42.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

42.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
42.str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

43.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
43.str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.

43.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
43.str2: From en and brimaomai; to have indignation on, i.e. to blame, to sigh with chagrin, to sternly enjoin.

44.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

44.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

44.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

44.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: A prolonged form of an obsolete primary of the same meaning; to show.

44.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 2nd Person Singular

44.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.). From hieros; a priest.

44.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

44.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
44.str2: (a) I instruct, command, (b) I appoint, assign. From pros and tasso; to arrange towards, i.e. enjoin.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

44.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
44.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From katharizo; a washing off, i.e. ablution, expiation.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of martus; something evidential, i.e. evidence given or, the Decalogue.

44.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
44.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

45.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

45.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
45.str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Much, many; often.

45.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
45.str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
And, even, also, namely.
To report, publish abroad. From dia and a derivative of pheme; to report thoroughly, i.e. Divulgate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

45.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
45.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Clearly, openly, manifestly. Adverb from phaneros; plainly, i.e. Clearly or publicly.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

45.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
45.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
And, even, also, namely.

45.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
45.str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

45.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
45.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From all sides, on all sides. Adverb from pas; from all sides.
